channel.title: Outdated redash/nginx:latest image
channel.description:
Hey everyone,
a recent PCI (security) check on our clients installation pointed to an outdated nginx version that redash uses in its docker image. I checked the docker-compose file and realized that the docker image used for nginx is "redash/nginx:latest", which has a hardcoded nginx version in its env file: nginx-1.9.10-1~jessie.
Is there any chance that this could be upgraded on your end, or that you could allow us to override the variable via a custom env variable?
I fear that more people may need to upgrade nginx for similar reasons.
Thanks & Regards, Paul
